net.amoebaman.utils
Class ChatUtils

java.lang.Object
  net.amoebaman.utils.ChatUtils

public class ChatUtils
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains utilities for working with Minecraft's chat box, to make pretty and understandable text easier to code. The ChatUtils.ColorScheme enum is specifically designed so that multiple plugins can use the same color scheme, which can later be changed at will via a configuration.

All of the text-alignment functions are based off of Minecraft's default chat font widths. They will most likely be slightly off if you use a texture pack that changes the font.

Author:
AmoebaMan

spacerLine

public static java.lang.String spacerLine()
Gets a line that when broadcast in chat will result in an empty line, since empty messages don't display at all.

a spacer line

fillerLine

public static java.lang.String fillerLine(java.lang.String pattern)
Gets a line of text, repeating the given pattern, that will fill one line of the chat box as completely as possible without spilling to the next line.

Parameters:

Returns:

dyeToChatColor

public static org.bukkit.ChatColor dyeToChatColor(org.bukkit.DyeColor color)
Gets the closest possible interpretation of a dye color as a chat color, for Minecraft defaults.

Parameters:

Returns:
the corresponding chat color

format

public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.String line)
Applies some basic formatting rules to the given text. "&&" is replaced with the Minecraft color delimiter, "//" begins italic text (unless preceded by ':' as in a URL), "**" begins boldface text, "__" begins underlined text, and "\\" reverts to normal text.

Parameters:
line - some plain text
Returns:
the formatted text

format

public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.String line,
                                      ChatUtils.ColorScheme scheme)
Applies color-scheme specific formatting to the given text, in addition to standard formatting as specified by format(String). The entire string is started off by the color scheme's default color. "[[" begins the scheme's emphasis color, and "]]" reverts to the scheme's standard color.

Parameters:
line - some plain text
scheme - a color scheme
Returns:
the formatted text

makeProgressBar

public static java.lang.String makeProgressBar(int length,
                                               int total,
                                               java.util.List<org.bukkit.ChatColor> colors,
                                               java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> values)
Makes a progress bar, capped by square brackets and filled with colored pipes. If the number of listed colors exceeds the number of listed values, and the listed values do not add up to the total value, the first unmatched color will be used to complete the bar.

Parameters:
length - the number of colored pipes that will be used in the bar
total - the total value of all values
colors - a list of colors to be used
values - a list of values corresponding with colors
Returns:
the progress bar, ready for display

lines - some text
